metadata.how_to_trigger: oe fullaudienceoe unlockrooftopoe mooaudience_tadpoleThen walk all the way up to the top of MOOTriggered when you approach Ketheric on the Moonrise rooftop

24.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
24.text: I'll tell you a story, True Soul. About a man who sold himself piece by piece.
24.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

108.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
108.text: He had... everything. A wonderful wife. A brilliant daughter. They lived not far from here.
108.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

110.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
110.text: His wife died too young. Grief tore through their home like a thief, snatching away the scent of her hair, the rustle of her skirts. But the man did not break.
110.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

35.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
35.text: He could not break. His daughter needed him whole, after all.
35.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

87.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
87.text: She grew up - grew strong. Challenged him. Filled his heart with such joy it supplanted all sorrow.
87.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

16.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
16.text: When she was killed, the man... he tried to remain whole, but it wasn't possible. Do you understand?
16.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

34.speaker: Player
34.text: So the man fell to pieces.
34.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

96.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
96.text: The pain was unbearable. All-consuming. He decided he'd do anything for reprieve.
96.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

60.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
60.text: First, he sold himself to the goddess of loss. But the pain did not subside, no matter his obscene feats of devotion.
60.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

125.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
125.text: Then a new god came - a god who promised the man something wonderful: his daughter. Her life returned. Imagine it.
125.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

66.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
66.text: He would have to give everything: his body and soul entire. He did not hesitate. Not for a moment.
66.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

52.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
52.text: And the new god did as promised. The man's brilliant, beautiful daughter came back. She was whole - she was alive. But she despised the pitiful wretch her father had become.
52.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

51.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
51.text: Her hatred he could bear, perhaps, as long as she had another chance to live.
51.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

74.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
74.text: Everything I've done, everything I have built, has been to give Isobel that chance. And you, True Soul - you have squandered it.
74.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I didn't know Isobel was your daughter, General. I submit myself to your judgement.
129.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

78.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
78.text: Not my judgement. Be glad for that, True Soul.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: You brought her back once. Do it again.
109.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

63.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
63.text: I can. I will. But it is not without cost. Who will pay this time, True Soul?
63.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

86.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
86.text: I have no mercy left in me - but it is for the Absolute to decide your fate.
86.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

83.speaker: Player
83.text: She opposed the Absolute. Why mourn her?

79.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
79.text: Every god I have served, I have served in my daughter's name. And it almost came to nothing because of you.

75.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
75.text: I've retrieved my daughter's body - the one you so ruthlessly injured. She will live again. I want you to pay for what you've done.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Sorry about the cleric, but I'm here for an audience with the Absolute.

14.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
14.text: You had best dredge up some scrap of respect, True Soul. You will need it.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Vengeance is the best antidote to grief.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: It's subtle, but let me guess - the man is you.

54.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
54.text: So you understand what you have cost me, True Soul?

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Does it matter? No sad story can undo the things you've done.

47.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
47.text: The things we have done, True Soul.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: What is this? I came to receive my audience with the Absolute.

4.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
4.text: You will listen. You will understand what you have cost me.

81.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
81.text: I pledged my body and soul entire to a new god: a god who promised me my daughter could be returned to me.

32.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
32.text: True Soul! I was so hoping to thank you in person.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric spots the player, opening his arms wide. InternalNodeContext: Player helped kidnapped IsobelNodeContext: Ketheric spots the player, opening his arms wide.

13.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
13.text: You've had your indiscretions, but I find I can forgive a great deal in light of what you've done.
13.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

77.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
77.text: Our forces are gathered, the Nightsong bound, and we are ready to march at last. But most importantly...
77.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

21.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
21.text: Isobel. You brought my daughter back to me.
21.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

115.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
115.text: She's being introduced to the Absolute as we speak. Soon it will be as though we were never apart. You have our thanks for your part in our reunion.
115.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: It was an honour to serve, my lord.
71.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

43.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
43.text: I'm sure it was. Though I can't imagine convincing Isobel to come to the Towers was an easy feat.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: You're Isobel's father? She wasn't overly keen on a reunion.
91.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: She wasn't overly keen on a reunion.
25.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

42.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
42.text: She was always stubborn. She clung to Selûne even after her mother's death.

9.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
9.text: Ironic, then, that it was Isobel who drove me into Shar's arms. She died, and I was left alone.

84.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
84.text: I made perfect prey for Lady Loss. She promised vengeance. Oblivion. But her plans came to naught.

0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
0.text: Only one god empowered me to bring my Isobel back. That is the god I serve now. The god we serve.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: So Isobel was dead, and you resurrected her?

22.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
22.text: From darkness into light. From oblivion back into her father's arms.

62.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
62.text: In the end, perhaps her death was a boon - an encouragement to point me toward our higher purpose.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I'm not sure Isobel would see it that way.

64.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
64.text: You're wrong. But you'll discover that for yourself, when you meet the Absolute.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: And I've served well. I've come to claim my reward.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: So you serve whichever god best serves you. A skewed philosophy.

100.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
100.text: I'll keep her close. Aylin was her name - an angel of Selûne's own brood, sent to guide and guard my line. Until she failed me.

6.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
6.text: Now she is Nightsong. Balthazar's greatest creation, and the source of my greatest strength.

37.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
37.text: How often our burdens can be made into boons, with the right encouragement.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Speaking of boons - I think I've earned one of my own.

29.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
29.text: That you have. That and more, True Soul.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Every god you served granted you power in their way. Hardly a burden.

101.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
101.text: A free tongue. You've earned that much, I suppose. But I do not have to explain myself.

73.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
73.text: You played your part. Don't spurn your reward just as you've earned it.

132.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
132.text: It's time for you to learn true power. Make use of my own altar. Kneel in Her name, and the Absolute will come.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I am ready to meet with the Absolute - if you'll permit it.

98.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
98.text: It is not for me to permit. You have earned this right.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I want to see the truth of this god. What's next?

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I only hope your daughter can embrace the Absolute's will.
39.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

68.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
68.text: No one of sound mind can look at what the Absolute offers and resist.

121.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
121.text: But I know it wasn't easy for Isobel to accept how our family has changed.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Taking Isobel was a mistake. I've come here to correct it.
93.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

69.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
69.text: You think to take Isobel from me again? Why, True Soul? Why come here just to die?
69.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

8.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
8.text: Make no mistake, that was always your fate. But I had hoped to make it painless.

95.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
95.text: I've heard a great deal about you, True Soul.
95.context: InternalNodeContext: NS captured but Isobel not captured

85.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
85.text: Indeed, I'd have thrown you off this tower by now if I didn't want to have a little chat first.
85.context: NodeContext: Alt take: "If that were true, you would not bring chaos to my dominion. Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you have come to me empty-handed, and uninvited."

106.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
106.text: You've travelled a long way to make it here. Lied. Fought. Even attacked me, who you ought to serve.
106.context: NodeContext: Alt take: "If that were true, you would not bring chaos to my dominion. Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you have come to me empty-handed, and uninvited."

44.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
44.text: You've travelled a long way to make it here. Lied. Fought. Killed - even those who would be your allies.
44.context: NodeContext: Alt take: "If that were true, you would not bring chaos to my dominion. Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you have come to me empty-handed, and uninvited."

27.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
27.text: You've travelled a long way to make it this far. Lied. Fought. Killed.
27.context: NodeContext: Alt take: "If that were true, you would not bring chaos to my dominion. Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you have come to me empty-handed, and uninvited."

15.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
15.context: NodeContext: Alt take: "If that were true, you would not bring chaos to my dominion. Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you have come to me empty-handed, and uninvited."

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I am devoted to the Absolute.
17.context: NodeContext: Alt take: "If that were true, you would not bring chaos to my dominion. Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you have come to me empty-handed, and uninvited."

19.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
19.text: If that were true, the Selûnite cleric would be standing next to me right this moment. Instead, Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you - you're here, before me, for some unfathomable reason.
19.context: NodeContext: Alt take: "If that were true, you would not bring chaos to my dominion. Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you have come to me empty-handed, and uninvited."

28.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
28.text: You're not like the others. Holy fervour does not motivate you. Nor does the promise of ultimate reward. How very sad for you.

59.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
59.text: If that were true, the Selûnite cleric would be standing next to me right this moment. Z'rell gave you an order - an order on my behalf - and you failed it.
59.context: NodeContext: Alt true: "If that were true, you would have delivered the Selunite cleric as Z'rell instructed you to do."

23.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
23.text: If that were true, you would have reported to Z'rell as you were told, you would have stayed off this roof as you were told, and you would be out there retrieving the Selûnite cleric!
23.context: NodeContext: Alt true: "If that were true, you would have reported to Z'rell as instructed rather than interrupting a private ceremony."

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I'd do whatever it takes to gain an audience with the Absolute.
72.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, like an extremely disappointed parent

46.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
46.text: And yet Isobel - the Selûnite cleric - is nowhere to be found. Z'rell instructed you quite clearly.
46.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, like an extremely disappointed parent

58.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
58.text: Who are you to defy the Absolute's orders? My orders?
58.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, like an extremely disappointed parent

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I brought you the Nightsong - just as you asked.
104.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, like an extremely disappointed parent

70.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
70.text: Half marks means you fail, True Soul.
70.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, like an extremely disappointed parent

67.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
67.text: The Absolute will decide your fate.
67.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, like an extremely disappointed parent

97.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
97.text: Kneel before the Absolute's altar. Throw yourself at Her mercy. Or try to earn Her forgiveness by retrieving the cleric Isobel. Your choice.
97.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

33.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
33.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

10.speaker: Player
10.text: What can I do to atone for my failure?
10.context: NodeContext: Shouting, the pinnacle of his rage.

131.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
131.text: Until the cleric is at my side, you are nothing. And you will be nothing until the Absolute cures you of the sin of your own mind.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: What could the Absolute possibly want with the cleric?
57.context: NodeContext: Shouting, the pinnacle of his rage.

114.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
114.text: Not only do you fail to carry out your orders, but you wish to question the Absolute?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: She didn't want to be brought here, General. She fears you.
18.context: NodeContext: Shouting, the pinnacle of his rage.

50.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
50.text: That is precisely why I sent you to retrieve her! She is lost. Confused. It is your holy duty to help me enlighten her.
50.context: NodeContext: Shouting, the pinnacle of his rage.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: She's your daughter, isn't she? Isobel Thorm. She fears you.
49.context: InternalNodeContext: Player has massacred Z'rell and others to get here.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I thought you'd be angrier about my slaughter of your faithful.
2.context: InternalNodeContext: Player has massacred Z'rell and others to get here.

5.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
5.text: Death will only strengthen their faith, and you had no orders to spare them. Your orders were to retrieve Isobel.

38.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
38.text: Either go back out there and retrieve the cleric, or kneel at the altar. See if the Absolute cares to explain Herself to you.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I could ask the same of you.

76.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
76.text: My motivations are clear, aren't they? I serve the Absolute.

107.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
107.text: But you - you have defied Her will and my orders. Balthazar instructed you to retrieve the Selûnite cleric, but instead you are here questioning me!

99.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
99.text: But you - you have defied Her will. You failed to take Isobel - the Selûnite cleric. Indeed, True Soul, she is nowhere to be found.

7.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
7.text: But you - you have defied Her will and my orders. You were to report to Disciple Z'rell. You were to aid my cause! Instead you're here, showing your worthless face to me.
